articles.description: Joshi, the senior-most director on the HPCL board, was in January picked by the government headhunter PESB to replace Mukesh Kumar Surana. Surana superannuated from services on April 30, 2022, but in absence of a formal order from the Appointments Committee o…
articles.content: New Delhi, Pushp Kumar Joshi on Sunday took over as the new chairman and managing director of India's third largest oil refining and fuel marketing company Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd (HPCL).… [+2100 chars]

articles.author: Press Trust of India
articles.title: Foreign funds share in India equities at 19.5%, lowest since March 19 - Business Standard
articles.description: Foreign funds' ownership in domestic equities fell to pre-Covid lows and hit a multi-year low of 19.5 per cent in March this year in NSE500 companies valued at USD 619 billion, shows an analysis
articles.content:

articles.author: PTI
articles.title: Future Enterprises to raise Rs 3,000 crore from stake sale in insurance arm to avoid insolvency - Moneycontrol
articles.description: Earlier on Thursday, Future Enterprises Ltd completed the sale of its 25 per cent equity in Future Generali India Insurance Company Ltd (FGIICL) to joint venture partner Generali for Rs 1,266.07 crore.
articles.content: Debt-ridden Future Group firm Future Enterprises Ltd expects to raise around Rs 3,000 crore from selling its stake in the insurance business to pare debt, which may save the company from facing the r… [+3657 chars]

articles.author: ET Now Digital
articles.title: Saudi prince replies after Elon Musk asks how much does Kingdom own in Twitter - Times Now
articles.description: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al-Saud initially rejected Elon Musk's offer of $54.20 per share to buy Twitter. The Saudi Prince who is an investor in Twitter had said the offer came nowhere close to the intrinsic value of the company
